page.title: 05RELIGION IN EAST MERSEA
page.content: Before World War Two the vicar lived in East Mersea but now he resides in West Mersea 5kms away and serves both parishes.The present vicar has been there four years. He is helped by a retired vicar and three Readers. There is a Church Warden who has lived in East Mersea since 1921. Weekly congregations drawn from the local population are small although holiday-makers from a nearby caravan site attend services in the summer and there is always a large congregation at Christmas when 105 have been recorded. There are few ceremonies in the church; only one marriage every two years and about two funerals each year. Some people travel to Colchester to attend other denominational churches on Sundays.
